source_sentence: 妙法蓮華經釋為為二章
translation: Miaofa lianhua jing shiyi weiyi zhang

source_sentence: 大慈恩寺　基　撰
translation: Dacien Temple, by Ji

source_sentence: 將欲辨為為二章略以五門分別一彰數定聲二依聲定訓三聲訓次第四就經分數七卷不同即分為七五申作者意。
translation: There are two abbreviated chapters that delineate the desire to discern into two categories: one that reveals the number of words and sets the sound; two that rely on the sound to set the instruction; and three that set the instruction in order.

source_sentence: 第一彰數定聲有二(一字數二定聲)總據一部都有六百一十八字二百九十一字平聲三百二十七字去聲。
translation: First, there are two ways to express the number of words and two ways to define sound (a word number and two ways to define sound), and in general, there are six hundred and eighteen words, two hundred and ninety-one words, flat sound, and three hundred and twenty-seven words, devoid of sound.

source_sentence: 第二依聲定訓平聲為(榮危反)有九訓(由求當得定被作是名)去聲為(榮偽反)有三訓(以與助)。
translation: The second is based on the sound of the set teaching, which has nine lectures in the plain voice (Eihei) and three lectures in the negative voice (Eihei) (with the aid of).

source_sentence: 第三聲訓次第然但隨其經初有彼聲即隨義訓論為次第是則聲訓始終使不相雜又復通標一句冀其文顯義彰尋之易見或在上中下也此中若同常喚但與訓之若違先所呼必為再言思義唯合博達賢德幸請詳焉。
translation: The third is the order of the sound lectures, but following the beginning of the sutra there is this sound that follows the meaning of the lectures as the order. This is the beginning and end of the sound lectures, so that they are not mixed up, and then a common denotation of a sentence in the hope that the text will be clear and the meaning will be clear.

source_sentence: 第四就經分數。
translation: The fourth section of the sutra deals with the number of words.

source_sentence: ○序品
translation: ○The preface section.

source_sentence: 常為諸佛(得)為諸菩薩(與二)為說涅槃(與)為說緣覺(與)為說淨道(與)為眾講法(與)不以為喜(是)為供舍利(以)為欲說此(定)為當授記(定)為說何等(定又當與)。
translation: He always teaches (attains) nirvāṇa (and) for the buddhas (and) for the bodhisattvas (and) for the solitary realizers (and) for the pure path (and) for the Dharma lectures (and) for the multitude (and) not for joy (and) for the offering of relics (and) for the desire to teach this (concentration) for future prediction (concentration) and for the explanation of what (concentration and will).

source_sentence: 為求聲聞(與)為求辟支(與)皆為法師(作)所為因緣(以)為人演說(由)為廣分別(與)為世間眼(是)為汝等說(與)曰為淨身(名)號為求名(作)當為除斷(與)。
translation: Seeking śrāvakas (and) seeking Pārśva (and) are causes and conditions (made by) the Dharma teacher (to) explain (to) people (from) for the sake of extensive discernment (and) for the sake of the worldly eye (which) explains (to) you (and) that for the sake of purifying the body (name) and for seeking the name (made) it will be removed (from).

source_sentence: 已上第一品二十三字九字平聲十四字去聲。
translation: The twenty-three words of the first class above have a flat sound and nine words and fourteen words have a deprecatory sound.

source_sentence: ○方便品
translation: ○The Chapter on Expedient Means

source_sentence: 事為云何(當)佛為解說(與)為是究竟(定)為是所行(定)為如實說(與)為佛長子(是)為此眾故(與)吾當為汝(與)當為汝說(與)是為諸佛(名)常為一事(以)為眾生說(與)而為眾生(與三)是法皆為(以三)而為說法(與)如此皆為(以)為是說涅(與)大乘為本(與)為此諸佛(與)為說大乘(與)事為不可(是)為說實相(與)為說方便(與)沙為佛塔(與作)若人為佛(以)實為一乘(以)實為佛乘(以)為是眾生(以)為諸眾生(與)為教菩薩(以)為五比丘(與)為說佛慧(以)為已供養(是)為諸法王(是)為如是等(與)。
translation: 事為云何(當)佛為解說(與)為是究竟(定)為是所行(定)為如實說(與)為佛長子(是)為此眾故(與)吾當為汝(與)當為汝說(與)是為諸佛(名)常為一事(以)為眾生說(與)而為眾生(與三)是法皆為(以三)而為說法(與)如此皆為(以)為是說涅(與)大乘為本(與)為此諸佛(與)為說大乘(與)事為不可(是)為說實相(與)為說方便(與)沙為佛塔(與作)若人為佛(以)實為一乘(以)實為佛乘(以)為是眾生(以)為諸眾生(與)為教菩薩(以)為五比丘(與)為說佛慧(以)為已供養(是)為諸法王(是)為如是等(與)。

source_sentence: 已上第二品四十字一十字平聲三十字去聲。
translation: The forty words of the second class above have a flat sound and thirty words have a negative sound.

source_sentence: ○譬喻品
translation: ○Metaphorical Chapter

source_sentence: 為自欺誑(是)為共為不(定是)為諸梵志(作)是魔所為(作)為天人所(得)為無上道(以)為諸聲聞(作)瑠璃為地(作)黃金為繩(作)為大寶故(名)恒為諸佛(得)除為王子(作)為王子時(作)光佛所為(作)願為四眾(與)皆為阿耨(以)為化菩薩(被)為火所燒(被)我當為說(與)無令為火(被)何者為舍(名)云何為失(名)此舍已為(被)必為取焚(被)非為虗妄(是)便為已得(是)則為一切(是)為度眾生(以)為生老病(被)不以為患(作)我為眾生(是)為諸眾生(□)而為三界(被)為說三乘(與)則為所燒(被)我今為汝(與)為求羊鹿(以)名為摩訶(作)為一切眾(是)為火所逼(被)將為火害(被)吾為汝等(與)以為茵蓐(作)能為救護(以作)我為眾生(與)為無有上(是)為此等故(以)為是等故(以)貪欲為本(是)為滅諦故(□)名為解脫(得)我為法王(是)為欲利益(以)則為見我(是)為深智說(與)亦勿為說(與)又復為人(被)為諸童子(被)為諸小虫(被)若得為人(作二)為人所使(被)以為衣服(作)乃可為說(十與)為一切智(以作)汝當為說(□)。
translation: To deceive (oneself), to share (with), to be untrue (certainly), to be done by priests (made), by Māra (made), by gods (attained), and for the unsurpassed way (made), for śrāvakas (made), for lapis lazuli as ground (made), for gold as rope (made), and for the sake of great treasures (named), always for the buddhas (attained), except for princes (made), when they are princes (made), by the Buddha of Light (made), and for the sake of the four groups (with), all become anointed (made), for the transformation of bodhisattvas (made), and are burned by fire (made).

source_sentence: 已上第三品八十一字四十六字平聲三十五字去聲。
translation: The eighty-one words in the third category above have a flat sound and forty-six words have a negative sound.

source_sentence: ○信解品
translation: ○The Chapter on Belief and Understanding

source_sentence: 何為見捉(得)為子名所(是)名之為兒(作)便為不異(是)我等為子(是)自以為足(得作)不為分別(作是)為諸菩薩(與)佛則為我(與)常為王者(得)為除冀穢(與)樂為鄙事(作)為大菩薩(與)但為菩薩(與)而不為我(與)自謂為足(得)無漏無為(作二)則為已得(是)我等雖為(與)能為下劣(作)隨宜為說(與)而為說法(與)。
translation: "What is it that we see and grasp (gotten) as the son and name (it) as the child (made), and then we are not different (it's) we are sons (it's) we consider ourselves to be sufficient (gotten) we don't discriminate (made) we are bodhisattvas (with) the buddhas (with) we are always the king (gotten) we remove defilement (with) we enjoy doing despicable things (made) we are great bodhisattvas (with) but we are bodhisattvas (with) we don't think of ourselves (with) we are sufficient (gotten) we are uncontaminated and unarisen (made) then we have attained (it's) though we are (with) we can be inferior (made) we explain (with) as appropriate (with) and preach (with).

source_sentence: 已上第四品二十四字平聲十字去聲。
translation: The twenty-four words of the fourth class above have a flat sound and a cross in the declension.

source_sentence: ○藥草喻品
translation: ○The Metaphor of Medicinal Herbs

source_sentence: 為聽法故(以)而為說法(與)不即為說(與)甚為希有(是)則為永失(作)隨力為說(與)為諸眾生(與)我為如來(是)我為世尊(是)為大眾說(與)常為大眾(與)恒為一切(與)如為一人(與)名為大樹(作)今為汝等(與)。
translation: For the sake of listening to the teaching (with) and speaking it (with) not immediately speaking it (with) it's rare (with) then it's lost forever (with) teaching it according to one's ability (with) for the sake of sentient beings (with) I am the Tathāgata (with) I am the Bhagavān (with) speaking it for the masses (with) always speaking it for the masses (with) always speaking it for all (with) as for one person (with) it's called the great tree (with) now it's for you all (with).

source_sentence: 已上第五品一十五字五字平聲十字去聲。
translation: The fifteen words of the fifth class above have a flat sound and a cross in the negative case.

source_sentence: ○授記品
translation: ○The Chapter of the Empowerment of Karma

source_sentence: 得成為佛(當三)瑠璃為地(□)黃金為繩(作二)為佛智慧(以)以為莊嚴(作)見為授記(與)頗梨為地(作二)為眾說法(與)皆為十方(得)為佛道故(以)常為天人(與)。
translation: He becomes a buddha (when three), lapis lazuli becomes the ground (□), gold becomes a cord (make two), and buddha's wisdom (is based on) his adornment (makes one), his vision becomes his empowerment (makes two), and he speaks for the multitude (makes two), all in the ten directions (get), and so he's always a god (and) a human being (for the sake of the buddha path).

source_sentence: 已上第六品一十一字平聲五字去聲。
translation: The sixth class above contains eleven words in the plain form and five in the negative form.

source_sentence: ○化城喻品
translation: ○The Metaphor of the City of Transformation

source_sentence: 磨以為墨(作)盡末為塵(作二)悉以為墨(作)塵為一劫(作)先為彼佛(與)為供養佛(以二)為度眾生(以)為得最大(當)願為世間(與)與分別顯(與)為諸梵眾(與四)為大得天(是四)為佛出世(是四)為眾生作(與)為眾生之(作)為世間眼(作)而為沙彌(作)為我等說(與)為阿耨多(以二)為四部眾(與)甚為希有(是)以為眷屬(作)為沙彌時(作)為說是經(與)為是等故(與)為止息耳(以)今為汝等(與)為止息故(以二)為說汝等(與)為覺悟群(以)為宣種種(與)為無量億(與)曾亦為汝(與)為一切導(作)為息說涅(與二)為說真實(□)今為汝等(與)為佛一切(作以)。
translation: The powder is made into ink, and the dust is made into dust. All of them are made into ink, and the dust is made into an eon. First, they are made to support the Buddha and to save sentient beings.

source_sentence: 已上第七品五十二字二十二字平聲三十一字去聲。
translation: The above seventh class of fifty-two words is composed of twenty-two flat sounds and thirty-one negative sounds.

source_sentence: ○五百弟子品
translation: ○Pañcaviṃśati-sāhasrikā-prajñāpāramitā

source_sentence: 所為希有(作)而為說法(與)最為第一(得)為淨佛土(以二)示為第一(得)為一佛土(作)七寶為地(作)為求無上(以)名為寶明(作)是等為僧(作)得成為佛(當)號為普明(作)當為宣說(與)小智為足(作)為衣食故(以)便以為足(作是)何為衣食(以)甚為癡也(是)為菩薩時(作)得少為足(作是)而汝謂為(是)自以為足(作)少便為足(作)乃為真滅(是)。
translation: That which is rare (made) and is taught (with) is the most excellent (attained) for the purification of the Buddha-lands (with two) is shown to be the most excellent (attained) for the one Buddha-lands (made) seven treasures for the grounds (made) for the pursuit of unsurpassed (attained) is called precious luminosity (made) such are the saṃgha (made) to attain Buddhahood (will be) called universal luminosity (made) will be explained (with) little wisdom as the feet (made) for food and clothing (made) then it will be the feet (made) what is food and clothing (made) is very deluded (made) and when you are a bodhisattva (made) you attain little as the feet (made) and you say (it's) your own to be the feet (made) little will be the feet (made) then it's true cessation (made).

source_sentence: 已上第八品二十五字十八字平聲七字去聲。
translation: The twenty-five words of the eighth class above have a plain sound and eighteen words and seven words have a negative sound.

source_sentence: ○人記品
translation: The Latter Portion of the Record of Humanity

source_sentence: 等為一切(是)常為侍者(作)瑠璃為地(作)佛為十方(得)方便為侍(作)常為諸佛(與)亦為此佛(與)為太子時(作)羅睺為長(作)受法為法(名)皆為其長(作)現為我長名為實相(作)。
translation: Equally, they are all (made) constant attendants (made), lapis lazuli is the ground (made), the buddhas are the attendants (made) in the ten directions (attained), and they are always the buddhas (made) and this buddha (made) when he was crown prince (made), Rāhu was the head (made), received the teaching as the teaching (named), and they are all the head (made) who is now the head of what's called the true character (made).

source_sentence: 已上第九品一十三字十一字平聲二字去聲。
translation: The ninth class above contains thirteen words, eleven with a flat sound and two with a deponent sound.

source_sentence: ○法師品
translation: ○The Dharma Teacher Chapter

source_sentence: 竊為一人(與)廣為人說(與)則為如來(得二)最為難信(是)為他人說　則為以衣(得被作)又為他方(得)而為開示　當知是為(名二)欲為四眾(與)應為四眾(與)為諸菩薩(與)為其集聽(作)我還為說(與)廣為分別(與)慈悲為室(作)法空為座(作)處此為說(與)為眾生說(與)為之作衛(與)爾時為現(與)為說今通(與)為四眾說(與)為作聽法(與)。
translation: "Secretly, for one person (and) he explains (to) a wide range of people (and) then the Tathāgata (attains two) is the most difficult to believe (in) and speaks (to) for others, then he uses robes (attains to be made) and (attains to) reveal it for others. You should know that this is (called two) for the sake of the four groups (and) for the sake of the four groups (and) for the sake of the bodhisattvas (and) for the sake of their gathering and listening (to be made).

source_sentence: 已上第十品二十六字平聲十六字去聲。
translation: The twenty-six words in the tenth class above have a flat sound, and the sixteen words have a negative sound.

source_sentence: ○寶塔品
translation: ○Treasure Pagoda Chapter

source_sentence: 以為嚴飾(作)為大眾說(與)為聽是經(以)為作證明(與)為聽法華(以)頗梨為地(作)以為莊嚴(作)為眾說法(與)瑠璃為地(作二)黃為為繩(作)以為侍者(作)為莊莊嚴(作)通為一佛(作)為諸佛當(以與)為聽是經(以)尚為法來(與)不勤為法(與)為坐諸佛(以)則為供養(是)為是經故(以)則為見我(當)此為難事(是)未足為難(是)亦未為難(是)為眾演說(與)是則為難(是六)為人演說(與)我為佛道(作)則為疾得(是)。
translation: 以為嚴飾(作)為大眾說(與)為聽是經(以)為作證明(與)為聽法華(以)頗梨為地(作)以為莊嚴(作)為眾說法(與)瑠璃為地(作二)黃為為繩(作)以為侍者(作)為莊莊嚴(作)通為一佛(作)為諸佛當(以與)為聽是經(以)尚為法來(與)不勤為法(與)為坐諸佛(以)則為供養(是)為是經故(以)則為見我(當)此為難事(是)未足為難(是)亦未為難(是)為眾演說(與)是則為難(是六)為人演說(與)我為佛道(作)則為疾得(是)。

source_sentence: 已上第十一品四十五字三十字平聲十六字去聲。
translation: In the eleventh class above, there are forty-five words and thirty characters in the plain voice and sixteen characters in the declension.

source_sentence: ○提婆品
translation: ○Tibet pinyin

source_sentence: 為欲滿足(以)為於法故(以二)誰能為我(與)當為宣說(與)而為牀座(作)為求大法(以)為我解說(與)當為奴僕(作)當為汝說(與)為諸眾生(與)不為己身(以)為大國王(作)故為汝說(與)廣為眾生(與)為眾生故(以)普為十方普為時會(與)。
translation: For the sake of fulfilling desires (with) For the sake of the teaching (with) Who can explain (with) for me (with) Who will make a seat (with) For the sake of seeking the great teaching (with) Explain (with) for me (with) Who will be my servant (with) Who will explain (with) for you (with) For the sake of sentient beings (with) Not for myself (with) For the sake of the great king (with) Therefore, I will explain (with) for you (with) Widely for the sake of sentient beings (with) For the sake of sentient beings (with) Universally in ten directions, I will universally explain (with).

source_sentence: 已上第十二品一十八字三字平聲十五字去聲。
translation: The twelfth class above contains eighteen words, three in plain voice and fifteen in negative voice.

source_sentence: ○勸持品
translation: ○The Chapter on Encouragement and Maintenance

source_sentence: 不以為慮(是)為大法師(作二)俱為法師(作)願不為慮(當)未得謂為(是)為世所恭(得)為貪利養(以)為求名聞為斯所經(以被)為說是經(以)。
translation: Not thinking (of) being a great teacher of the Dharma (as two), they both are teachers of the Dharma (as) vowing not to think (of) what's yet to be attained, which is to say that they are (attained) for the sake of worldly respect (to) desire for profit (to) seek fame and renown (to be) for the sake of teaching this sūtra (to).

source_sentence: 已上第十三品一十一字八字平聲三字去聲。
translation: The thirteenth class above contains eleven words, eight in plain voice and three in negative voice.

source_sentence: ○安樂行品
translation: ○The Chapter on Conducting Yourself in Harmony

source_sentence: 甚為難有(是)能為眾生(與)則為說法(與)而為說法(與二)以為親厚(作二)若為女人(與)乃至為法(與)為聞佛道(以)為利殺害(以)為女說法(與)是則名為(作二)有為無為(作二)為諸國王(與)而為解說(與)隨問為說(與)和顏為說(與)不為多說(與)則為大失(是二)常為比丘(得)為聽法故(以)常為法故(與)為說諸經(與)而不為說(與)為大法王(是)最為甚深(是)為說此法(與)能為難事(作)為諸法王(是)為是眾生(與是)末後乃為(與)此經為尊(是)為汝等說以為給使(作)佛為四眾(與)而為供養(作)即為授記(與)聞法為人(與)為四眾說(與)。
translation: 甚為難有(是)能為眾生(與)則為說法(與)而為說法(與二)以為親厚(作二)若為女人(與)乃至為法(與)為聞佛道(以)為利殺害(以)為女說法(與)是則名為(作二)有為無為(作二)為諸國王(與)而為解說(與)隨問為說(與)和顏為說(與)不為多說(與)則為大失(是二)常為比丘(得)為聽法故(以)常為法故(與)為說諸經(與)而不為說(與)為大法王(是)最為甚深(是)為說此法(與)能為難事(作)為諸法王(是)為是眾生(與是)末後乃為(與)此經為尊(是)為汝等說以為給使(作)佛為四眾(與)而為供養(作)即為授記(與)聞法為人(與)為四眾說(與)。

source_sentence: 已上第十四品四十四字一十七字平聲二十七字去聲。
translation: In the fourteenth class above, there are forty-four words and one-seven words in plain voice and twenty-seven words in negative voice.

source_sentence: ○涌出品
translation: ○The Chapter of Springing Out

source_sentence: 最為上首(是)為從何所(定)誰為其說(與)為求佛道(以二)為太子時(作)為佛道故(以)甚為希有(是)願為解說(與二)為除眾疑(與)佛為未來(與)今為解說(與)。
translation: Most excellent chief (is this) From where (is this) Who will explain (to him) Who will seek the Buddha's path (to two) When he was crown prince (made) For the sake of the Buddha's path (to two) May he explain (to two) To remove all doubts (to two) The Buddha is the future (to two) Now he will explain (to two).

source_sentence: 已上第十五品一十三字四字平聲九字去聲。
translation: The fifteenth class above contains thirteen words, four in plain voice and nine in negative voice.

source_sentence: ○壽量品
translation: ○Longevity Chapter

source_sentence: 彌勒為首(作)末為微塵(作)盡以為塵(作)為是人記皆為度脫(以)為度眾生(以二)為毒所中(被)為眾生故(與)為說無上(與)不為現身(與)乃出為說(與)時為此眾(與)為說佛難(與)為治狂子(與)亦為世人(是)為凡夫顛(與)為說種種(與)。
translation: Maitreya is the first (to do), and the last is a particle (to do), and all these are recorded by people as having been liberated (by), as having liberated sentient beings (by both), as having been in the presence of poison (by), for the sake of sentient beings (with), as having explained the unsurpassed (with), not for the sake of the present body (with), and then having emerged to explain (with), for the sake of this multitude (with), as having explained the difficulties of the Buddha (with), as having cured the mad (with), and for the sake of the world (with), as having explained the various (with), for the sake of the confusion of ordinary people (with).

source_sentence: 已上第十六品一十八字五字平聲十三字去聲。
translation: In the sixteenth class (already mentioned), the five words are in the plain voice, and the thirteen words are in the negative voice.

source_sentence: ○分別功德品
translation: ○The Chapter on the Merit of Discrimination

source_sentence: 為阿耨多(以與)為此所輕(被)福為如此(得)則為見佛(是)是為深信(是)則為頂戴(是)不須為我(與)為已起塔(是)為已於無(是)則為起立(是)為他人說(與)又為他人(與)則為具足(是)為已如上(是)隨順為解(與)無漏無為(作)。
translation: To attain this despised (to be given) merit is to see the Buddha (yes), to become deeply convinced (yes), and to carry (yes) on one's head (yes), not to raise a stūpa (yes) for one's own sake (yes), and to erect (yes) for the sake of the nonexistent (yes), to speak (yes) for others (yes), and to complete (yes) for the sake of others (yes), as above (yes), and to accord with for understanding (yes), uncontaminated, and unproductive (yes).

source_sentence: 已上十七品一十九字十三字平聲六字去聲。
translation: The above seventeen lessons and nineteen words have thirteen flat sounds and six devoid of sound.

source_sentence: ○隨喜功德品
translation: ○The chapter on the merit of following one's heart

source_sentence: 為得幾所(當)為父母宗　寧為多不(是)為是經故(以)為人分別(與)隨喜為他(與)為方便說(與)不可為譬(得)為人所喜(得)。
translation: "How many (should) it be for the school of parents? Rather for many than (is it) for the sake of this sūtra (to) discern (with) for people (to) delight in for others (to) explain (with) for the sake of skillful means (to) not for the sake of metaphors (to) delight in for people (to).

source_sentence: 已上第十八品九字四字平聲五字去聲。
translation: The nine words of the eighteenth class (already mentioned) have a flat sound and five words in negative form.

source_sentence: ○法師功德品
translation: ○Faoshi gongde pin

source_sentence: 若為他人(與二)為忉利諸(與)為他人說(與)或為人說(與)為聽法故(以)或時為現(與)為眾生說(與)為一切眾(與)。
translation: "If he speaks (to) for others (and two) for the sake of the grieved ones (and) for others (and) or speaks (to) for the sake of people (and) for the sake of listening to the teaching (with) or sometimes for the present (and) for the sake of sentient beings (and) for all of them (and).

source_sentence: 已上第十九品九字令是去聲。
translation: The nine words of the nineteenth class above make the declension.

source_sentence: ○不輕品
translation: ○Never Despising Chapter

source_sentence: 中為天人(與)為求聲聞(與)為求辟支(與)為說菩薩(與)為常不輕(名)廣為人說(與)是人為作(與)為諸四眾(與)為他人說(與)為人說故(與)復為諸人(與)。
translation: "Among them are gods and humans (and) śrāvakas (and) śrāvakas (and) śrāvakas (and) bodhisattvas (and) who preach for others (and) who are never despised (named) and preach for others (and) who do (and) preach for the sake of the four groups (of people) (and) others (and) who preach for the sake of others (and) who also preach for others (and).

source_sentence: 已上第二十品一十一字一字平聲一十去聲。
translation: The above is the twentieth class of eleven words, one with a flat sound and ten with a deponent sound.

source_sentence: ○神力品
translation: ○The Chapter on Spiritual Powers

source_sentence: 為諸菩薩(與)為囑累故(以)為悅眾生(以)為求佛道(與)為已見我(作)。
translation: "For the sake of the bodhisattvas (and) for the sake of their entrustment (to) please sentient beings (in order) to pursue the Buddha Way (and) to have seen self (made).

source_sentence: 已上第二十一品五字平聲四字去聲。
translation: In the twenty-first class above, the five words are in the plain voice and the four words are in the negative voice.

source_sentence: ○囑累品
translation: ○The chapter on entrustment

source_sentence: 當為演說(與)為令其人(以)則為已報(是)。
translation: It will be explained (and given) in order to cause others (to) then be rewarded (for having done so).

source_sentence: 已上第二十二品三字一字平聲二字去聲。
translation: In the twenty-second class above, the three words have a flat sound and two devoid of sound.

source_sentence: ○藥王品
translation: ○The Medicine King Chapter

source_sentence: 七寶為臺(作)以為供養(作)佛為一切(與)即為其父(與)栴檀為[卄/積](作)海為第一(是)最為深大(是)山為第一(是)最為其上(是)最為第一(是三)最為照明(是)最為其尊(是)佛為第一(是)亦為第一(是)菩薩為第(是)為諸法王(是)不復為貪(被)不為嗔恚(被)不為憍慢(被)為他人說(與)則為閻浮(是作)。
translation: The seven treasures make a platform (made) for making offerings (made), the Buddha is the father of them all (made), the sandalwood is [twenty/plenty] (made), the ocean is the greatest (yes), the deepest and largest (yes), the mountains are the greatest (yes), the highest (yes), the greatest (yes), the most brilliant (yes three), the most illuminating (yes), the most honored (yes), the Buddha is the greatest (yes), and the greatest (yes), the bodhisattvas are the greatest (yes), the king of the Dharma (yes), they don't crave (yes), don't get angry (yes), don't get proud (yes), and speak for others (yes and), then they are Yama (yes made).

source_sentence: 已上第二十三品二十三字二十一字平聲三字去聲。
translation: The twenty-three words of the twenty-third class above are in the plain form and three in the negative form.

source_sentence: ○妙音品
translation: ○Sublime Sound Chapter

source_sentence: 為無量無(以)而為說法(與五)檀金為莖(作二)白銀為葉(作二)金剛為鬚(作二)以為其臺(作二)願為我等(與)當為汝等(與)能為供養(以)為諸眾生(與二)變為女身(作)而為現形(與)。
translation: He preaches (with five) sermons (with five) using gold for stalks (made up of two), silver for leaves (made up of two), and vajra for beards (made up of two) to serve as a platform (made up of two) for us (with) and for you (with) to be able to make offerings (to) sentient beings (with two) and transform them into the body of a woman (made up of) and give her form (with).

source_sentence: 已上第二十四品二十一字九字平聲十二字去聲。
translation: The twenty-fourth class above contains twenty-one words, nine with a flat sound and twelve with a deponent sound.

source_sentence: ○觀世音品
translation: ○The Chapter on Avalokitêśvara

source_sentence: 若為大水(破)為求金銀(以)而為眾生(與)而為說法(與十九)為施無畏(作)為觀世音(作)我為汝略(與)為人所推(被)為作依怙(與)。
translation: "If you seek gold or silver for the sake of great waters (to break) and speak for the sake of sentient beings (with) and for the sake of giving fearlessness (to do) and for the sake of Avalokitêśvara (to do), I will abbreviate (with) for you (to be) pushed (by) people (to be) made a refuge (with).

source_sentence: 已上第二十五品二十七字四字平聲二十二字去聲。
translation: The twenty-seven words of the twenty-fifth class above have a flat sound and twenty-two words have a negative sound.

source_sentence: ○陀羅尼品
translation: ○The Chapter of the Dhāraṇī

source_sentence: 寧為多不(是)則為侵毀(是三)亦為擁護(與)亦為愍念(以)。
translation: "Rather than being numerous(ish), it's offensive(ish) and defensive(ish); it's also protective(ish) and compassionate(ish).

source_sentence: 已上第二十六品六字四字平聲二字去聲。
translation: The six words of the twenty-sixth class above have a flat sound and two devoid of sound.

source_sentence: ○嚴王品
translation: Chapter of King Śubhavyūha

source_sentence: 為現神變(與)師為是誰(是當)我等為父(與)為王說法(與)為欲發起(以)。
translation: "For the sake of manifesting miracles (and) teachers, who are (they will be) we as fathers (and) preach for the king (and) want to give rise to (by).

source_sentence: 已上第二十七品五字一字平聲四字去聲。
translation: The five words of the twenty-seventh class above have a flat sound and four devoid of sound.

source_sentence: ○普賢品
translation: ○The Chapter of Samantabhadra

source_sentence: 名為說之(與)為諸佛護(得)為魔所著(被)亦為供養(以)名為旋陀(是)而為說法(與)不為女人(被)為諸如來(得)為千佛授(得)為釋迦牟(得二)不為三毒(被)不為婬妬(被)。
translation: It's called preaching it (and) it's protected by the buddhas (attained), it's adhered to by Māra (being), and it's an offering (to) the name Cunda (which is) and preaches it (and) it's not for women (being), it's for the tathāgatas (attained), it's for the thousand buddhas (attained), it's for Śākyamuni (attained), it's not for the three poisons (being), and it's not for sexual misconduct (being).

source_sentence: 已上第二十八品一十三字一十平聲三字去聲都計六百一十八字(二百九十一字平聲三百二十七字去聲)。
translation: The twenty-eighth class above contains thirteen words, ten in plain voice, three in negative voice, and six hundred and eighteen words (two hundred and ninety-one in plain voice, three hundred and twenty-seven in negative voice).

source_sentence: 第五通申作意者謂此門通釋五門大旨恐類古人只定訓作被二音不體餘之訓釋顯示後來未覺者知訓釋之由定佛語之要九義三義一乘五乘須明將曉喻法之體故云爾。
translation: The fifth one is the interpretation of the five aspects of the general idea that this aspect of the interpretation of the general idea of the five aspects of the fear that the ancients only set out to teach the two sounds and not the essence of the rest of the teaching and interpretation shows that those who have not yet realized the later know the reason for the interpretation of the teaching and interpretation of the set out to the essence of the Buddha's words nine meanings three meanings one vehicle and five vehicles must be understood to be the essence of the metaphorical dharma that will be revealed so it is called.

source_sentence: 妙法蓮華經為為二章(終)
translation: Miaofa lianhua jing weize ii zhang (end)
